Key Match Events: Coby White narrowly missed his first career triple-double, finishing with 23 points, 10 rebounds, and nine assists.
Torrey Craig scored 18 points with five 3-pointers after halftime.
Nikola Vucevic added 16 points and 13 rebounds for the Bulls.
Miles Bridges had 31 points, 12 rebounds, and eight assists for the Hornets.
Bridges hit a leaning 3-pointer with 2 seconds left to send the game into overtime.
The Bulls raced to an eight-point lead in overtime with contributions from White, Vucevic, and Craig.
Patrick Williams knocked down a corner 3 off an assist from Lonzo Ball with 49 seconds left in overtime to push the Chicago lead to seven.
Pre-Game Insights: The Ball brothers matchup never materialized as LaMelo Ball missed the game due to wrist soreness.
Brandon Miller (sprained ankle) also sat for the Hornets.
Zach LaVine (toe soreness) and Ayo Dosunmu (soleus strain) were out for Chicago.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Torrey Craig didn't play in the first half but was a huge spark after the break, finishing 6 of 10 from the field and 5 of 7 from 3-point range.
Tre Mann will miss at least another two weeks with disc irritation.
LaMelo Ball has now missed 116 of Charlotte's last 196 games over the past three seasons.
The Wizards host the Bulls on Wednesday night. The Hornets visit Detroit on Friday night.
